name: Chicken Adobo
description: Filipino Chicken Adobo is the national dish of the Philippines and may well become your new favourite Asian chicken dish!
directions: Heat oil in pan and sauté garlic and onions. Then add chicken to the pan and sear on all sides, until you have a little browning in the chicken skin.

Pour in vinegar, soy sauce and water. Add bay leaves, pepper and Knorr Chicken Cubes. Bring to a boil over high heat then reduce heat to simmer, but do not cover the pan. Continue to simmer for 10 mins.
Remove chicken pieces from sauce and fry in another pan until nicely browned.
Put back fried chicken pieces into sauce. Add sugar and let simmer again for another 10 minutes or until sauce has thickened. Serve warm.
ingredients: 1 tsp whole black peppercorns, slightly crushed

name: Chicken Tinola
description: Chicken Tinola is a classic Filipino soup made with chicken, ginger, garlic, and green papaya or sayote (chayote) in a flavorful broth.
directions: In a pot, sauté garlic, ginger, and onion until fragrant.
Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned.
Pour water into the pot and bring to a boil. Simmer until chicken is tender.
Add green papaya (or sayote) and chili leaves. Simmer until vegetables are tender.
Season with fish sauce and pepper. Serve hot with steamed rice.
ingredients: 1 whole chicken, cut into serving pieces
1 pc green papaya or sayote (chayote), sliced

name: Pork Caldereta
description: This perfect holiday dish combines the rich taste of pork ribs with the tangy tomato sauce infused with chorizo, black olives, potatoes, and Knorr Pork flavors
directions: Get a large pot and make it nice and hot over medium-high heat. Fill it with 3 cups of water then add the pork ribs. Boil at high heat and bring down to a simmer for 30 minutes or until meat is tender. Remember to remove the scum rising to the top of the liquid. Remove meat from pot, and set aside and strain the broth.

Get another pan ready and make it nice and hot over medium heat. Pour oil and sauté garlic and onions. Add the tender pork, chorizo, liver spread, laurel, tomato sauce, Knorr Pork Broth Cube, sugar, pepper and broth. Bring to a boil and simmer until slightly thick in consistency.
Throw in the potato and carrots next then simmer until cooked before adding the bell peppers and olives. Cook for another 2 minutes and that’s our dish!
It’s always a joy when you see Festive Pork Caldereta being served in the table by your mom. You know you can always count on this dish for this is home.
ingredients: 2 pcs Spanish chorizo or sausage sliced
1 pc medium-sized potatoes, cut into cubes
1 pc medium-sized carrots, cut into cubes
1 pc red bell pepper, seeds removed and sliced
1 pc green bell pepper, seeds removed and sliced

name: Beef Caldereta
description: Beef Caldereta is a Spanish inspired dish mixing flavors of beef and thick tangy tomato sauce, topped with potatoes and carrots for added flavors and textures
directions: Begin by tenderizing the beef in water. Pour the water enough to cover the meat with the quartered onions. Simmer, covered, until beef is tender. Remove the scum that has formed on the surface. Once beef is tender, strain out from the broth and set aside beef and the broth.
Get a pan and make it nice and hot over medium heat. Pour some oil and throw in the onions and garlic and sauté until light brown in color.
Add in the tenderized beef and saute for 1 minute.
Stir in the liver spread, tomato paste and bay leaves. Mix well.
Add 1-1/2 cups of the broth and Knorr Beef Cube. Simmer for 5 minutes before adding the potatoes and carrots. Continue to simmer until vegetables are tender and sauce has slightly thickened.

Lastly, add bell peppers. You may also add the olives and cheese at this point, if desired. And that's it! Classic Beef Kaldereta is best enjoyed with the company of loved ones because something as good as this is best shared with family.
ingredients: 1 kilogram beef kaldereta cut or shortribs
4 pcs potatoes, peeled and cut into cubes
2 pcs carrots, peeled and cut into cubes
1 pc green bell pepper, deseeded and cubed
1 pc red bell pepper, deseeded and cubed

name: Fish Tinola
description: Upgrade a classic Filipino tinola by adding a seafood twist. Find a new favorite in this fish tinola featuring hasa-hasa and Knorr Fish Cubes.
directions: Begin by getting a pot and fill it with water. Place the salt in together with the ginger, tanglad, sili espada, onion and Knorr Fish Broth Cubes.
Close the pot and just allow the ingredients to simmer over medium heat for 8-10 minutes, then lower the heat to simmer.
Now, gently add the fish and cook just until the fish eyes turn white.
Add pechay and spring onions next and just simmer until veggies are cooked. And that's it! Our dish is done and may be enjoyed by the entire family.
ingredients: 2 pcs large Hasa-hasa, cleaned and cut into 2
4 stalks spring onions, cut into 2 inch segments

name: Lechon Kawali (Pork)
description: Lechon Kawali is a crispy Filipino pork belly dish. It's typically served with a dipping sauce made of vinegar, soy sauce, and chili.
directions: Boil pork belly in water with salt, pepper, and bay leaves until tender.
Remove pork belly from the pot and let it cool.
Deep fry the pork belly until golden and crispy.
Slice and serve hot with a vinegar dipping sauce.

name: Egg Adobo
description: This dish uses the traditional Adobo style sauce, which uses soy sauce and chicken broth flavors, as a marinate for hard boiled eggs.
directions: In a medium size pot, add the eggs then add enough water to cover the eggs. Place the pan over high heat and let the eggs boils for 8-10 mins. Once timer is done, remove the eggs from the heat and transfer them to a large bowl with ice cold water. This will stop the cooking process and make the eggs shells easier to remove.

In a different pan, let's make the adobo marinate. Start by adding oil and sauté the onions until soft and brown. Add in the soy sauce, water and crushed Knorr Chicken cube. Set it to boil and continue to heat until all ingredients are fully dissolved. Remove from heat, and let it cool down.
Once the marinate is already warm, gently add the boiled egg and let it stay in the adobo sauce for at least 5 mins. Cut the eggs in half before serving.

name: Bicol Express (Pork)
description: Bicol Express is a spicy Filipino stew made with pork, coconut milk, shrimp paste, and chili peppers. It's named after the train that travels from Manila to the Bicol region.
directions: In a pan, sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add pork and cook until browned.
Stir in shrimp paste and coconut milk. Simmer until pork is tender.
Add chili peppers and simmer until sauce thickens.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Escabeche (Fish)
description: Escabeche is a Filipino sweet and sour fish dish made with fried fish, bell peppers, carrots, and onions in a sweet and tangy sauce.
directions: Fry the fish until golden brown. Set aside.
In a pan, sauté garlic and onions until fragrant.
Add bell peppers and carrots. Cook until slightly softened.
Pour in the sweet and sour sauce and bring to a simmer.
Add the fried fish to the pan and cook until heated through.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Pork Adobo
description: Pork Adobo is made with succulent pork belly braised in vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, and onions.
directions: Get a pot and make it nice and hot over medium heat. Pour some oil and sauté garlic and onions. Add pork and continue sautéing until cooked.

Pour Knorr Liquid Seasoning, water, vinegar, laurel leaves, sugar, and pepper. Add 1pc Knorr Pork Cubes. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to a simmer, make sure that you don't cover the pan to evaporate the vinegar. Cook for 10 more minutes.
Remove the meat from the sauce and fry, to add extra crispiness and color to the meat. Return the fried meat in sauce. Reheat and simmer until sauce thickens.

name: Paksiw (Fish)
description: Paksiw na Isda is a Filipino fish dish cooked in vinegar, garlic, ginger, and spices. It's a popular way to cook leftover fish.
directions: In a pot, combine vinegar, water, garlic, ginger, peppercorns, and bay leaves.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then add the fish.
Simmer until the fish is cooked and the sauce has thickened.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
ingredients: 500 g fish (mackerel, tilapia, or pompano), cleaned

name: Chicken Curry
description: Chicken Curry is a Filipino version of the popular curry dish, made with chicken, potatoes, carrots, and bell peppers in a creamy coconut milk sauce flavored with curry powder.
directions: In a pan, sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned.
Stir in curry powder, coconut milk, potatoes, carrots, and bell peppers. Simmer until chicken and vegetables are cooked through.
Season with fish sauce or salt to taste. Serve hot with steamed rice.
ingredients: 1 whole chicken, cut into serving pieces
Fish sauce or salt to taste
